New Records: Freddie Freeman tied the Series record of 12 RBIs, set by Bobby Richardson over seven games in 1960.
Shohei Ohtani became baseball’s first 50-homer, 50-steal player.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers overcame a five-run deficit to win Game 5 of the World Series 7-6.
Errors by Aaron Judge and Anthony Volpe contributed to the Dodgers scoring five unearned runs in the fifth inning.
Mookie Betts and Gavin Lux hit sacrifice flies in the eighth inning to secure the win.
Walker Buehler pitched a perfect ninth inning for his first major league save.
Freddie Freeman hit a game-ending grand slam in Game 1 reminiscent of Kirk Gibson’s homer in 1988.
Pre-Game Insights: In spring training, the Dodgers aimed to win the World Series and achieved it.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed heartbreak over the loss.
Freddie Freeman highlighted the importance of capitalizing on extra outs.
Shohei Ohtani reflected on the strength and success of the team.
Dave Roberts mentioned the emotional significance of the upcoming parade on Fernando Valenzuela's birthday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers won their eighth championship and seventh since moving to Los Angeles.
The Dodgers led the big leagues with 98 wins in the season.
The Dodgers will celebrate with a parade on what would have been Fernando Valenzuela's 64th birthday.
Others: The Dodgers spent $1.25 billion last offseason on deals with key players including Shohei Ohtani, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Tyler Glasnow, James Paxton, and Teoscar Hernández.
The Dodgers' payroll was boosted to $266 million, third behind the Mets and the Yankees, with a projected $43 million luxury tax.
